body: Think about the case, when you converting a `uint8` image from RGB to grayscale. You first convert the image to `float32`, then do the conversion, you may get the value like `0.9/255`. when converting back to `uint8`, it supposed to be rounded to `1`. I guess this conversion bug will cause mistakes in many other image operations, like resize.
